intro: Seriphium kilimandscharicum, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, dry conditions. Its yellowish to reddish flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Seriphium kilimandscharicum is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
